Key Match Events: The Dodgers made history by hitting three leadoff home runs in the first inning of the game.
The Diamondbacks scored four times in the bottom of the first, benefiting from poor Dodgers defense on Corbin Carroll’s inside-the-park home run.
The Dodgers responded with two runs in the second, only to watch the Diamondbacks tie the score on a Gurriel Jr. homer in the third.
Another one-run Dodgers’ lead in the fifth was erased by some Arizona small-ball in the seventh.
The Dodgers finally went in front for good in the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Miguel Rojas expressed that winning games like this down the stretch is important for the team's preparation for the playoffs.
Dave Roberts emphasized the grit and fight shown by both teams.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Chase Field in Phoenix.
Others: The Dodgers won the game 8-6, taking the first two games of the weekend's divisional series against the Arizona Diamondbacks.
